title: Calories in Meats
meta_description: Discover calories in meats per 100 g, including protein, fat, carbs for common cuts like beef, chicken, and pork, with breakdowns and variations.
assumptions: Average for cooked lean meats (e.g., beef sirloin, chicken breast, pork tenderloin); no added fats or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type, cut, fat content, cooking method, and brand. Check labels for specific products.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of average cooked lean meats contains about 180 kcal and 25 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Fatty cuts (e.g., ribeye or bacon) vs. lean
Grilled with 1 tsp oil per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g of beef?
faqs.a: About 180-250 kcal depending on cut; lean sirloin is ~180 kcal.

faqs.q: What are calories in chicken meat?
faqs.a: Skinless breast is ~165 kcal per 100 g; with skin ~200 kcal.
Lean pork tenderloin ~180 kcal per 100 g; bacon much higher at ~500 kcal.

faqs.q: Do all meats have zero carbs?
faqs.a: Plain meats have 0 g carbs, but processed or marinated ones may add some.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in meats?
faqs.a: Grilling or baking keeps calories similar; frying adds 40-100 kcal from oil.
